intro: Erechtites albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflower ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are white to pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Erechtites albiflorus is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
